hero.slogan: An open-source, lightweight, and self-hosted reverse proxy gateway for AI APIs
hero.subtitle: Proxify supports mainstream model providers such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, and more.

features.title: Features

extensibility.title: Powerful Extensibility
extensibility.description: Supports reverse proxying for any website, with special optimizations for LLM APIs (streaming, heartbeats, tail-end sprinting, and controllable worst-case latency).

streaming_optimization.title: Streaming Optimization
streaming_optimization.description: Built-in flow controller ensures smooth, natural-feeling output. Supports inserting heartbeats into SSE streams to prevent connection timeouts.

multi_domain_routing.title: One-Path Multi-Domain Routing
multi_domain_routing.description: Route to different upstream services using a single path prefix (e.g., `/openai` → `api.openai.com`), making configuration simple and efficient.

lightweight.title: Lightweight & High-Concurrency
lightweight.description: Built with Golang for minimal resource consumption. Runs smoothly even on a machine with just 0.5 GB of RAM.

security.title: Security & Privacy
security.description: Self-hosted deployment ensures your data never passes through third-party servers, guaranteeing privacy and security.

open_source.title: Open Source & Transparent
open_source.description: The code is fully open-source, with transparent and auditable logic. Freely modify, extend, and deploy privately to avoid vendor lock-in.

maintenance.title: Maintained by a Professional Team
maintenance.description: Designed, iterated, and maintained long-term by a team of AI professionals. Contributions (PRs & Issues) are welcome.

ease_of_use.title: Extremely Easy to Use
ease_of_use.description: Switching to Proxify is as simple as changing a single line—the Base URL. No other parameter changes are needed.

tail_end_sprinting.title: Tail-End Sprinting
tail_end_sprinting.description: Ensures a seamless, smooth output stream while keeping worst-case latency within an acceptable range.

features.mit: This project is licensed under the MIT License

quick_start.title: Quick Start
quick_start.subtitle: In just a few simple steps, you can seamlessly connect your existing services to the Proxify proxy.

one.title: Identify the Target Service
one.description: Browse our list of supported APIs to find the service you need and its corresponding proxy prefix.

two.title: Replace the Base URL
two.description: In your code, replace the original API base URL with our proxy address, and append the service prefix identified in the previous step.

three.title: Send the Request
three.description: Everything is ready. Use your existing API key and request parameters to make requests as usual — no other changes are required.
three.note: Your API key, headers, and request body remain exactly the same.

supported_api.title: Broadly Compatible API Endpoints
supported_api.description: We aim to support all major and emerging LLM providers, enabling seamless switching with a single configuration.
supported_api.note: The route configuration file (routes.json) can be retrieved via API:

show.note: The example below uses /openai as a sample; other endpoints work similarly.
show.description: Proxify is an open-source, lightweight reverse proxy service compatible with major AI model providers such as OpenAI, Anthropic, and Gemini.

footer.slogan: An open-source, lightweight reverse proxy for multiple AI model providers’ API endpoints.
